title: Julian Dehne
text:
Dehne J., Strickroth S., & Lucke U. (2020): FL-Trail: digitally supporting group-based inquiry learning. In: Zender R., Ifenthaler D., Leonhardt T., & Schumacher C. (Eds.): DELFI 2020 - Die 18. Fachtagung Bildungstechnologien der Gesellschaft für Informatik e.V. Bonn: Gesellschaft für Informatik e.V. (pp. 319-330).
Dehne Julian, Knoth Alexander, & Lucke Ulrike (2019): Strengthening the study entry phase research-based learning and the use of digital media. In: Gabi Reinmann, Eileen Lübcke, and Anna Heudorfer (eds.): Research-based learning in the study entry phase. Wiesbaden: Springer Fachmedien Wiesbaden.
Dehne Julian, Schiefner-Rohs Mandy, & Lucke Ulrike (2017): Digital media and research-oriented teaching and learning-empirical insights into projects and teaching concepts. In: Proceedings of the 25th Annual Meeting of the Society for Media in Science (GMW), September 5-8, 2017, Chemnitz, Germany: Waxmann. (Best Paper Award)
Dehne Julian, Wiepke Axel, & Lucke Ulrike (2017): Evaluating e-learning - A comment on “Media will never influence learning”. In: Christoph Igel, Carsten Ullrich, and Wessner Martin (eds.): Bildungsräume2017: Gesellschaft für Informatik Bonn, pp. 167-177.





Dehne Julian, & Lucke Ulrike (2015): An infrastructure for cross-platform competence-based assessment. In: Facing the Challenges of Assessing 21st Century Skills in the Newly Emerging Educational Ecosystems (ECTEL), Toledo, pp. 29-38.
Dehne Julian, & Nguyen Thi (2017): Defining consistency in higher education. EARLI 2017, Tampere, August 2017. (Poster).
Dehne Julian, Nguyen Thi, & Lübcke Eileen (2017): A model of media-supported inquiry-based learning. EARLI 2017, Tampere, August 2017. (Poster).
Dehne Julian, Nguyen Thi, & Lucke Ulrike (2016): Bridging the interinstitutional gap - Tracing lifelong skill evolution. In: The Higher Education Conference (HEC). (Presentation).
Zender Raphael, Dehne Julian, Geßner Hendrik, & Lucke Ulrike (2013): RouteMe - Routing in ad hoc networks as a pervasive learning game. In: i-com12(1), pp.45-52.
Paaßen B., & Dehne J. (2022): A conceptual graph-based model of creativity in learning. In: Frontiers in Education, (p. 851). Frontiers.





Dehne J., & Gold V. (2024, under review): Comparing the Effectiveness of Different User Moderation Strategies for Deliberation on Twitter. In: Journal of Political Communication.
Dehne J., & Gold V. (2024, under review): Strategies for Deliberative Moderation in Social Media. In: Journal of Deliberative Democracy.

title: Contact

Contact
You can reach me via email at julian.dehne@gmail.com.

title: Julian Dehne
text:
Hello! I am Dr. Julian Dehne, a Research Associate at the University of Göttingen. My work focuses on educational technologies, public sphere and digital media, and empirical methods. This website showcases my academic journey, including my CV, publications, research interests, and teaching activities.
Feel free to explore and learn more about my work!

Email: julian.dehne@gmail.com
Website: ResearchGate Profile
Orcid: 0000-0001-9265-9619

text:

Curriculum research
